## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Bootstrap T-Test


```{r}
Mornin<-subset(project,select=count,subset=Block=="8 to 3",drop=T)
Afternoon<-subset(project,select=count,subset=Block=="3 to close",drop=T)
boxplot(count~Block,data= project)
hist(Mornin)
hist(Afternoon)
summary(Mornin)
summary(Afternoon)
MHr<-subset(project,select=Hourly,subset=Block=="8 to 3",drop=T)
AHr<-subset(project,select=Hourly,subset=Block=="3 to close",drop=T)
mean(MHr)
mean(AHr)
qqnorm(Mornin)
qqline(Mornin)
qqnorm(Afternoon)
qqline(Afternoon)
```

Permutation Test
```{r}
DCount<-subset(project,select=count,drop=T)
observed<- (mean(Afternoon)-mean(Mornin))
N<- 10^5-1
result<- numeric(N)
for (i in 1:N)
{
 index<- sample(10,size=5,replace=FALSE)
 result[i]<-(mean(DCount[index])-mean(DCount[-index]))
}
(sum(result<= observed)+1)/(N+1)
```

T-Test 
```{r}
t.test(DCount)
```

```{r}
m1<-mean(Mornin)
m2<-mean(Afternoon)
m3<-mean(MHr)
m4<-mean(AHr)
s1<-sum(Mornin)
s2<-sum(Afternoon)
thetahat<- m3-m4
SE<-(sqrt(m1)/sqrt(s1))+(sqrt(m2)/sqrt(s2))
thetahat+c(-1,1)*1.96*SE
```

```{r}
q1<-qt(.975,9)
s3<-sum(DCount)
m5<-mean(DCount)
lambda<-(-(q1^2/s3+2*m5)+c(-1,1)*sqrt((q1^2/s3+2*m5)^2-4*s3^2))/-2
```
